intro: Clidemia sulfurea, commonly known as golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and its striking yellow to gold-colored flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine, silky hairs. Clidemia sulfurea thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
